terms.name: contact affiliation
terms.value: Key Laboratory of Marine Biogenetics and Resources, Third Institute of Oceanography, State Oceanic Administration, Xiamen 361005, Fujian, P.R. China

description: Proteomics data demonstrate that skin mucus of the air-exposed  large yellow croaker  had a complex composition, with an unexpectedly high number of proteins (3,209), suggesting its multiple protective mechanisms possibly involved in antioxidant functions, oxygen transport, immune defence, and osmotic and ionic regulation. These results expand our knowledge of skin mucus secretion and function in fish, highlighting its importance in response to stress.

keywords.name: submitter keyword
keywords.value: Large yellow croaker, Larimichthys crocea ；Skin mucus；Air exposure；LC–MS/MS

Genome Sequencing of the Perciform Fish Larimichthys crocea Provides Insights into Molecular and Genetic Mechanisms of Stress Adaptation. PLoS Genet. 2015 Apr 2;11(4):e1005118. eCollection 2015 Apr

title: Large yellow croaker skin mucus proteome
